txt.en: Investigate the rumours about the Dalish town of Utterby.

'Though we cannot be sure without, as I said, marching straight into the lion's mouth, I fear the rumours we had heard in court hold some truth here. Jangovar tents at both gates, their flags raised and the Dalish ones thrown down? That is truly an ill sign carved in plain runes, if you ask me.'
Now that you have scouted the perimeter of Utterby, you should talk to Spall.
Investigate the rumours about the Dalish town of Utterby.

'Behold, [placeholder]: Utterby, a trading town of the Dale-men. At least, that is what it had been before the battles upon the Ironfold. Viewed from a distance, one cannot help but suspect some of the rumours we have heard are true.\n\n'I am not a warrior and I have no desire to march into the lion's mouth, yet all the same, we must get a bit closer to be sure. Let us tour both the southern gate and the east gate, and see if we may learn who controls Utterby now, and how that has come to pass.'
You should scout Utterby with Spall, making sure to get a view of the south and east gates, and looking out for signs of who controls the town now and how that came to pass.
You should talk to Spall about investigating the rumours regarding Utterby.
Investigate the rumours about the Dalish town of Utterby.
'A siege or an occupation? That is the question.'
'Tents at the south gate... and those are Jangovar milling about!'
'This flag of the Jangovar has been been set up along the path.'
'The east gate is fully guarded by the Easterling foe. Do Dale-folk remain within?'
'Torn down by foes, one can only imagine!'
